Fig 2 summarizes the steps of our proposed method for calibrating stochastic epidemic models. The set Θ in Step 1.b includes parameter values for which the likelihood function (1) should be calculated. This set can be built by sampling from the prior distribution π 0( θ) or via other sampling methods including random, Latin hypercube, or orthogonal sampling. Obviously, the sample set Θ can be modified as new observations become available and the prior distribution π 0( θ) is being updated. However, the main advantage of fixing the sample set Θ at the beginning of the algorithm is to allow the algorithm to update the likelihood function (1) in a recursive manner as new observations are accumulating over time.
